details.title: BENGALURU
details.content: Eminent historian and researcher Ramachanda Guha seen at the protest holding #NotInMyName banner.

BENGALURU:  

"I have been waiting for something like this to come up because this can't go on," said a young participant to NDTV.

NEW DELHI:

Participants claim unlike in Bengaluru, where a silent protest is going on, the Delhi chapter has music and slogans with people wearing Not in My Name 'vests' made out of paper

details.title: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
details.content: <iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fpraveen.stoneage%2Fvideos%2F10156296494723452%2F&show_text=0&width=224" width="224" height="400" style="border:none;overflow:hidden" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowTransparency="true" allowFullScreen="true"></iframe>

LUCKNOW:

"If we didn't say anything today we just be egging these incidents on," said a history student at Delhi University.

NEW DELHI:

"The lynchings are not random events, these are driven by an ideology," said an elderly man.

details.title: NEW DELHI
details.content:
Systematic campaign of hate afoot in India. Citizens of India, speak up, fight the bigots! #NotInMyName 6pm Jantar Mantar Delhi.

— Sagarika Ghose (@sagarikaghose) June 28, 2017

details.title: MUMBAI
details.content: Heavy showers in the city don't deter Mumbaikars from attending the mass event. Several people are seen holding umbrellas and protesting under the pouring rain.

details.title: MUMBAI
details.content: Citizens from all works of life seen with umbrellas, drenched , rallying out cries of Not In My Name.

details.title: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
details.content: The city witness campus songs like "We shall resist, We shall overcome" been taken into the streets.

details.title: CHANDIGARH
details.content: "Muslims don't need to prove we belong here. We are also part of this nation and deserve to live here peacefully," said a protester in white clothes.

details.title: TWITTERATI
details.content:
Nobody killed Junaid. Not a single eye witness comes forward to tell police who & how the 16yo was killed. Shame on Indians. #NotInMyName

— Sasidharan Pazhoor (@inquestioner) June 28, 2017

details.title: TWITTERATI
details.content:
Good to see people out for an important cause. #NotInMyName pic.twitter.com/fQQ9GsJ74x

— Jrao (@KVJayantRao) June 28, 2017

details.title: KOCHI
details.content: <iframe width="100%" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VZ2oh-sTNGY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

details.title: CHANDIGARH
details.content: "I am a senior citizen and a mother. I would like to see which mother would allow this kind of incidents. If we keep accepting these kind of things, where are we heading?", asked an elderly woman holding a blue umbrella.

details.title: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
details.content: "Minority are suffering in the country, there is no equality," said  Mitra, an elderly woman who is a translator by profession.

details.title: NEW DELHI
details.content: "What I really like about this is that it is a citizen's protest not under any political umbrella," said a youngster holding a poster saying "Stop Islamophobia".

details.title: NEW DELHI
details.content: "What I really like about this is that it is a citizen's protest not under any political umbrella," said a youngster holding a poster saying "Stop Islamophobia".

details.title: KOCHI
details.content: <iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RcNu7IPZ51A" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

BENGALURU:

In Bengaluru, people take part in a silent protest against the lynchings around the country. The protest is a part of NotInMyName campaign that is happening in different parts of the country. | Pushkar V

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM:
"The secular fabric of this country cannot be altered. If anyone out there wishes to do so, a strong message should be sent to them. The people of this country will unite against such moves and this movement prove it," said a woman, one among many female volunteers distributing anti-communal placards to the participants.

HARYANA:

Father of Junaid Khan, the fifteen year-old who was killed in a train, told CNN News 18 in an interview, "We are very thankful that you people are doing this for my son".

NEW DELHI:
Pehlu Khan was killed by cow vigilantes in Rajasthan's Alwar district on April 1.

Family and relatives of Pehlu Khan and Junaid at Jantar Mantar #NotInMyName pic.twitter.com/5vArz7Qvj5

— Ashish (@AshishXL) June 28, 2017

MUMBAI:
Campaigners must disperse by 7:00 PM when their permitted time for the public gathering ends.

BENGALURU:
Playwright Girish Karnad joins the campaign as police try to clear off the protesters.

BENGALURU:

Reports come in that police are asking protesters to disperse.

#NotInMyName Bangalore pic.twitter.com/2hbDUtlnny

— Parth Gandhi گاندھی (@iPGandhi) June 28, 2017

LONDON:
Protesters gather at short notice in London to express solidarity with the movement in India.

KOLKATA:
"Efforts to reach out to the commoners of the country should start from individual level. Caste and religious differences should be cast aside for the greater cause," said a homemaker to the media.

HYDERABAD:

Police trying to snatch a poster from a protester. | Sayantan Ghosh (Express Photo Service)

TWITTERATI:
Ramachandra Guha tweets:

At the #NotInMyName citizens rally in my home town. This poster says it best. pic.twitter.com/6ZKgcdIHKS

— Ramachandra Guha (@Ram_Guha) June 28, 2017

details.title: #NotInMyName
details.content: The protests are currently taking place in 19 places throughout the country.

details.title: HARYANA
details.content: An ex-pilot told Junaid's father, "As a citizen of India I am very shameful that we couldn't keep your son safe. We are very sorry. And we promise that we will stand up against such violence that has been brewing in this country in the past few years."

details.title: NEW DELHI
details.content: Chinna, a singer, alleges that the government is facilitating lynchers to get away with murder of people like the teenager Junaid.

details.title: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
details.content: Upon the campaign slowly losing its participants, Joe, a student said, "If not now, the people of this country will realise the importance of movements like these. It is only a matter of time now. I am not scared to do my part even if I am the last campaigner here today."

details.title: CHANDIGARH
details.content: "We are not here to discuss politics. We are humans first, then we are Indians, then only Hindus or Muslims," an agitator tells a TV channel.

details.title: BENGALURU
details.content: Protests in the city are almost over. People who are left are waiting for their cabs.

details.title: HYDERABAD
details.content: Protesters in Hyderabad used black armbands along with posters, banners and placards.

details.title: PUNE
details.content:
A Twitter user puts out a call for a similar demonstration in Pune tomorrow

Every act of violence that you tolerate without protest, brings it a step closer to your doorstep
Come be a part
June 29 @Pune#NotInMyName

— Abrar Sayyad (@AbrarSayyad) June 28, 2017

Instant tweets from campaigners going viral on Twitter. 

हम देखेंगे
लाज़िम है कि हम भी देखेंगे
वो दिन कि जिस का वादा है
जो लौह-ए-अज़ल में लिख्खा है #NotInMyName pic.twitter.com/sXBaHSRtDe

— Dhiru rautela (@dhiru_rautela) June 28, 2017

details.title: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
details.content: "India is the land of diversity. Dalits and Muslims also belong to this country," a teen with a white headband and anti-lynching poster tells the media.
